qas.question: The success of the Communists helped what political group?
Where did anti-semitic attitude spread primarily?
What was one the rumors that Jews were doing in regard to shelters?

answers.text: secured the best shelters via underhanded methods

qas.question: What was feared would happen when different races were mixed in shelters?

context: The brief success of the Communists also fed into the hands of the <a0_0>British Union of Fascists (BUF)<a0_0/>. Anti-Semitic attitudes became widespread, <a1_0>particularly in London<a1_0/>. Rumours that Jewish support was underpinning the Communist surge were frequent. Rumours that Jews were inflating prices, were responsible for the Black Market, were the first to panic under attack (even the cause of the panic), and <a2_0>secured the best shelters via underhanded methods<a2_0/>, were also widespread. Moreover, there was also racial antagonism between the small Black, Indian and Jewish communities. However, the feared <a3_0>race riots<a3_0/> did not transpire despite the mixing of different peoples into confined areas.
